title: Heading
description: Semantic heading component (h1-h6) with flexible visual styling, responsive sizing, and marketing enhancements

metadata.description: Semantic heading component supporting all 6 HTML heading levels with flexible visual styling. Features responsive sizing with clamp(), size overrides to decouple semantic meaning from visual size, alignment options, color variants, font weight control, and marketing enhancements including eyebrow text, gradient fills, and text balancing. Optimized for brochureware marketing sites with conversion-focused design patterns.

accessibility.notes: Uses proper semantic heading levels (h1-h6) for document structure. Color variants meet WCAG AA contrast requirements. Gradient text respects high contrast mode.

responsive.notes: Uses clamp() for fluid responsive sizing. Each heading level scales proportionally from mobile to desktop. Supports explicit size overrides for visual flexibility.

performance.notes: Heading component is critical for SEO and page structure. Minimal CSS using design tokens.

bestPractices: Use only one h1 per page for SEO
Follow semantic heading hierarchy (don't skip levels: h1 → h2 → h3)
Use size overrides to decouple visual design from document structure
Test gradient text in dark mode and high contrast mode
Keep headline copy concise (5-15 words optimal)
Use first-person CTAs when appropriate ('Start My Trial' vs 'Start Trial')
Eyebrow text should be short labels (1-3 words)
Use text-wrap: balance for multi-line headlines (automatic)

seo.notes: Proper heading hierarchy is essential for SEO and accessibility. Use semantic levels (h1-h6) correctly. Size overrides allow visual flexibility without sacrificing structure.

text.description: Heading text content (required unless using caller content)

level.description: Semantic heading level (h1-h6). Controls HTML tag and document structure.

size.description: Visual size override (optional). Decouples visual size from semantic level. Example: h2 with size '4xl' renders as h2 but looks like h1.

color.description: Color variant. Uses semantic color tokens that adapt to dark mode.

gradient.description: Apply gradient text fill (primary to secondary brand colors). Best for hero headlines. Automatically disabled in high contrast mode.

eyebrow.description: Small label text above heading (e.g., 'New Feature', 'Case Study'). Common in marketing designs.

id.description: Unique identifier for the heading element

ariaLabel.description: Accessible label override for screen readers

ariaDescribedBy.description: ID of element that describes this heading

role.description: ARIA role override (rarely needed for semantic headings)
